issue.title: Empty titlebar option
issue.body: I'd like there to be an option for the titlebar to be empty. I'm going to open a PR for this myself pretty soon. Just letting everyone know.

body:
Prior art: https://github.com/dominictarr/rc

I couldn't find anything equivalent in crates.io in a cursory search.

It seems to me that the simplest implementation would be to make every option configurable from either command line flags or a config file, and then simply filter the exposure of those options, i.e. by selectively listing them in `-h` and the example config file.

Thinking about this there currently are a lot of "issues" with alacritty's configuration system anyways. There's the fallback (in case anything fails to parse), there's the deprecation stuff and there's the issue mentioned here.

It might make sense to write a crate that wraps serde to take care of these basic configuration file necessities. It should be trivial for alacritty contributors to add new config options without having to worry how that might completely crash alacritty or break already existing configuration files used today.

Maybe https://crates.io/crates/config can help?

**EDIT:** Another thing that comes to mind which is currently not yet supported by alacritty is merging config files from different paths together.
I think that makes a lot of sense. (That link appears to be broken, though.)
`config` looks like it's more geared toward web applications, and not necessarily command line applications.

issue.title: Add command line option '--foreground #rrggbb'
issue.body: I manage about 20 systems and am able to open a terminal to any one of them over ssh.  I have a different font colour which helps me recognise what system I'm on.  Can a new command line option be added  '--foreground #rrggbb' so that I can use only the one default config yml file?  I'm already very impressed by alacritty and would like to see it become even more useful.  Many regards.

issue.title: font selection and sizing from command line?
issue.body:
This is really a question rather than a bug report.

Is there a reason why the selection of a font and its size cannot be done as a command line argument?  Granted, it is possible to create several config files that would specify the sizes and pass those, but it sounds so gross.

issue.title: feature request: change background dependening on focus
issue.body:
Especially when using any given terminal with a tiling window manager, it is crucial to to know which window is focused. With many terminals open, things can get confusing fast. One way to tell the focused and the no focused windows apart, is to slightly change the background. As the background is a big area, even a small change is recognized by the human eye.

#### Proposal:

1. Add a subgroup `not-focused` to the `colors` group in the config. This subgroup contains all the keys of the ordinary `color` group, and each value defaults to the depending value of the ordinary `colors` group.
If the an alacritty instance is focused, use the values from the ordinary `colors` group, else use the `not-focused` group.
2. Move the `background_opacity` key to the `colors` group. I would consider the opacity as part of the visual appearance. So for a given colorscheme, the opacity should be with the colors, not somewhere else.
3. Consider renaming the `colors` group to `visual` or something with a similar meaning. Once again, I think it's desirable to have all the visual aspects in one place.

#### Benefits

+ Further integration of common principals regarding human perception
+ Having another feature which is not broadly available to other terminals
+ Possible eye candy
     + Think of a terminal which is colorful when focused, but all black, white and grey tones when not focused
     + Or almost no opacity on focus, but higher opacity when not focused
     + ...
+ Better structured config

#### Demonstration

See how one can easily determine which of the given terminals is focused, despite having no borders, no big fonts or other unique indicators of focus (the orange title indicates focus, but as the background and other elements are colored orange too).

**With focus dependant background:**
![screenshot_20190107_123717](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20400405/50766336-1427b480-1279-11e9-93b0-2cc67f3a33ad.png)
**Without:**
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20400405/50766704-82b94200-127a-11e9-8475-8f445c60f211.png)

Of course this is one thing you can do with it, but there is many other possibilities to use this.

What are you thoughts on this? I'm happy for feedback, whether this might be a desirable feature or whether it is in contradiction to `alacritty`s principals.

issue.title: Add CLI flag to override config options
